poem:
### Morning Politics

Burnham stands, resolute in Manchester's fog,  
defending the rooted ones,  
the expats tethered to the soil,  
like his wife, whose Dutch roots  
thread through English earth.  
Plans draw lines across nations,  
but in his voice, a call—  
for stones that make the walls,  
for leaves that remain.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Burnham claims he is ‘completely committed’ to his Greater Manchester mayoral job - UK politics live 11.03am BST Burnham condemns Reform UK's plan to end indefinite leave to remain Asked what he thought of the Reform UK plan to end indefinite leave to remain, Burnham said that he did not think these plans were fair to people who have been living in the UK for a long time. His wife was from Holland, he said.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Burnham claims he is ‘completely committed’ to his Greater Manchester mayoral job - UK politics live 11.03am BST Burnham condemns Reform UK's plan to end indefinite leave to remain Asked what he thought of the Reform UK plan to end indefinite leave to remain, Burnham said that he did not think these plans were fair to people who have been living in the UK for a long time. His wife was from Holland, he said.
